units.title: Label Transwell plates for organoid generation
units.text: Day 13: on day 13 of monolayer differentiation, label the required number of six-well Transwell plates for organoid generation. If performing PT functionality assays and immunofluorescence outlined below, 2.5 Transwell plates will be required.
units.rationale: Identifies the day and preparation needed before organoid aggregation.

units.title: Wash cells with TrypLE Select
units.text: Aspirate the CDBLY2 medium from each well of differentiated hPSC, wash with 1 mL/well of room temperature TrypLE Select, then aspirate and replace with a fresh 1 mL of TrypLE Select.
units.rationale: Removes previous medium and prepares cells for enzymatic detachment.

units.title: Dissociate cells to a single‑cell suspension
units.text: While the cells are incubating, place 1 mL of room temperature E6 containing 2% FBS into a 15 mL conical tube (one tube for every three or four wells of a 12-well plate). Gently detach the cells from the well surface by pipetting up and down a maximum of six times using a P1000 pipette, dissociating to a single-cell suspension.
units.rationale: Creates a uniform cell suspension required for micromass formation.

units.title: Centrifuge and resuspend cells
units.text: Top‑up the conical tube volume to 5 mL with E6/2% FBS and centrifuge the tube at 300 g for 3 min. Aspirate the supernatant and gently flick the tube three times to dislodge the cell pellet. Resuspend the cell pellet to a final volume of 2 mL of E6/2% FBS final volume, adding the medium gradually with a P1000 pipette and gently triturating the pellet during medium addition to resuspend to a single-cell suspension using minimal pipetting.
units.rationale: Pellets cells and restores them in a defined volume for accurate counting.

units.title: Count cells and aliquot for micromasses
units.text: Immediately remove 10 µL of the cell suspension for counting with a hemocytometer. Calculate the cell suspension volume required for 250,000 cells and dispense this volume into individual 1.5 mL microcentrifuge tubes, allowing one tube per organoid (Fig. 1).
units.rationale: Ensures precise cell numbers are used for each organoid micromass.

units.title: Centrifuge micromass tubes and transfer to Transwell
units.text: Top up the medium volume in each tube to 200 µL with E6/2% FBS. Centrifuge tubes three times at 300 g for 3 min, rotating the tubes 180° between each centrifugation step. Transfer three micromasses to each Transwell insert, working swiftly without delay. Ensure minimal medium carry‑over by allowing each micromass to settle into the pipette tip opening before dispensing in a single droplet that is touched onto the Transwell membrane.
units.rationale: Compacts the cell pellet into a micromass and places it onto the membrane for 3D culture.

units.title: CHIR99021 pulse for organoid patterning
units.text: Once all cell micromasses have been added to the membranes, perform a CHIR pulse by adding 1 mL of E6‑containing 5 µM CHIR99021 to the base of the Transwell and incubating the cell micromasses for precisely 1 h in the 37 °C incubator.
units.rationale: Temporarily activates WNT signaling to promote nephron elongation.

units.title: Replace medium with FGF9/heparin after CHIR pulse
units.text: Following the CHIR pulse, replace the medium with E6 containing 200 ng/mL FGF9 and 1 µg/mL heparin to initiate organoid patterning.
units.rationale: Provides growth factors that drive metanephric mesenchyme maturation.

units.title: Albumin uptake assay setup
units.text: Day 27: prepare two 15 mL conical tubes for the ‘test’ (with albumin) and ‘control’ (without albumin) conditions, each containing 4 mL of E6 medium. Add 4 µL of TRITC–albumin to 4 mL of E6 within ‘test’ conical tube (1:1,000 dilution). Remove a Transwell plate with six wells of day 27 PT‑enhanced organoids from the incubator. Aspirate culture medium from wells then add TRITC–albumin to ‘test’ wells and plain E6 to ‘control’ wells, first adding a drop on top of each organoid, then dispensing the remaining 1 mL to the basolateral compartment of each Transwell.
units.rationale: Establishes conditions to assess megalin/cubilin‑mediated protein uptake.

units.title: DAPI uptake assay for organic cation transport
units.text: Prepare three 15 mL conical tubes for the ‘substrate’ (with DAPI), ‘inhibitor’ (cimetidine) and ‘substrate + inhibitor’ (DAPI + cimetidine) conditions, each containing 4 mL of E6 medium and 4 µL of DRAQ7 dead cell stain (1:1,000 dilution). Add 4 µL of DAPI to ‘substrate’ and ‘substrate + inhibitor’ tubes containing 4 mL of E6 (1:1,000 dilution). Add 4 µL of 100 mM cimetidine to ‘inhibitor’ and ‘substrate + inhibitor’ tubes containing 4 mL of E6 (1:1,000 dilution, final concentration 100 µM). Incubate the organoids for 30 min in a 37 °C incubator. Add ‘substrate’ medium to the three test wells and ‘substrate + inhibitor’ medium to the three control wells, first adding a drop on top of each organoid, then dispensing the remaining 1 mL to the basolateral compartment of each Transwell. Incubate the organoids for 1 h in a 37 °C incubator.
units.rationale: Measures organic cation transport activity and its inhibition by cimetidine.
